intro: Herminium albosanguineum, commonly known as the white and blood red orchid, is a terrestrial orchid belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe, particularly in the Alps and Carpathian Mountains. The plant produces tall, slender stems that bear a single, showy spike of flowers with white petals and reddish-brown markings. Its flowers are typically 3–5 cm in length and bloom in late summer to early autumn. The orchid is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
